License Information

rax25kb - AX.25 KISS Bridge with Multi-Port Cross-Connect Support

Version

2.0.0

Author

Kris Kirby, KE4AHR

Date

December 2025

Primary License

rax25kb is free software licensed under the GNU General Public License version 3 or (at your option) any later version.

SPDX License Identifier: GPL-3.0-or-later

This means you are free to:

  • Use the software for any purpose

  • Study how the software works and modify it

  • Share the software with others

  • Share your modifications with others

Under these conditions:

  • Copyleft: Modified versions must also be free software under GPL

  • Source Code: You must make source code available when distributing

  • License Notice: You must include the license and copyright notices

  • State Changes: You must document changes you make to the software

License Text

rax25kb - AX.25 KISS Bridge with Multi-Port Cross-Connect Support
Copyright (C) 2025 Kris Kirby, KE4AHR

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with this program.  If not, see <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

Full License Text

The complete text of the GNU General Public License version 3 can be found:

  • In the LICENSE file included with this distribution

  • Online at: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html

  • From the Free Software Foundation: https://www.fsf.org/

If you did not receive a copy of the license with this software, you can obtain one by writing to:

Free Software Foundation, Inc. 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA

Why GPL?

The GPL was chosen for rax25kb to ensure that:

Freedom is Preserved

All users and developers have the same freedoms. Modifications and improvements remain free software.

Community Benefits

Improvements made by anyone benefit everyone. The entire amateur radio community can use and improve the software.

Transparency

Users can verify the software does what it claims. Important for radio communication systems.

Compatibility

GPL is compatible with many other free software licenses, making it easier to integrate with existing tools.

Amateur Radio Spirit

The GPL embodies the amateur radio principles of experimentation, learning, and sharing knowledge.

Copyright and Ownership

Primary Copyright Holder

Copyright (C) 2025 Kris Kirby, KE4AHR
Email: kris@outel.org
Call Sign: KE4AHR

Contributors

All contributors who submit code to rax25kb retain copyright to their contributions. By submitting code, contributors agree to license their contributions under the same GPL-3.0-or-later license as the project.

Contributor copyrights are recorded in:

  • Git commit history (with author information)

  • CHANGELOG.rst (for significant contributions)

  • Individual file headers (for substantial file contributions)

If you contribute significant code, you may add your copyright notice to relevant files:

Copyright (C) 2025 Kris Kirby, KE4AHR
Copyright (C) 2025 Your Name, YOUR_CALL

Third-Party Licenses

rax25kb depends on several third-party libraries, each with their own licenses. All dependencies use licenses compatible with GPL-3.0.

Rust Standard Library

License

MIT OR Apache-2.0

Copyright

The Rust Project Developers

Website

https://www.rust-lang.org/

serialport

License

MPL-2.0 (Mozilla Public License 2.0)

Description

Cross-platform serial port library

Website

https://crates.io/crates/serialport

The MPL-2.0 license is compatible with GPL when used as a library.

chrono

License

MIT OR Apache-2.0

Description

Date and time library

Website

https://crates.io/crates/chrono

ctrlc

License

MIT OR Apache-2.0

Description

Signal handling library

Website

https://crates.io/crates/ctrlc

License Compatibility

All dependencies use licenses that are compatible with GPL-3.0:

  • MIT License: Compatible with GPL, can be combined

  • Apache License 2.0: Compatible with GPLv3, can be combined

  • MPL 2.0: Compatible with GPL when used as a library

The combined work (rax25kb with all dependencies) is distributed under GPL-3.0-or-later as required by the GPL’s copyleft provision.

Full Dependency Licenses

Complete license information for all dependencies can be obtained by running:

cargo tree --format "{p} - {l}"

Or by examining the Cargo.lock file and checking each crate on https://crates.io/

Using rax25kb

As an End User

You may:

  • Download and use rax25kb for any purpose

  • Use it for personal, commercial, or amateur radio operations

  • Share copies with others

  • No registration or payment required

  • No warranty is provided (see disclaimer below)

You are not required to:

  • Release your configuration files (they’re not derivative works)

  • Share your usage or setup

  • Contribute back to the project (but it’s appreciated!)

As a Developer/Modifier

If you modify rax25kb, you must:

  • Make your modified source code available under GPL-3.0-or-later

  • Include all copyright and license notices

  • Document your changes

  • Provide a copy of the GPL license

You may:

  • Use modified versions privately without sharing

  • Distribute modified versions (with source code)

  • Charge for distribution services (not for the software itself)

  • Use modified code in your own GPL projects

Commercial Use

Commercial use is permitted under GPL-3.0. You may:

  • Use rax25kb in a commercial environment

  • Charge for installation, configuration, or support services

  • Integrate rax25kb into larger systems

You may not:

  • Distribute modified versions without providing source code

  • Remove or obscure copyright notices

  • Relicense the code under a non-GPL license

Contributing to rax25kb

License Agreement

By submitting code to rax25kb, you agree that:

  • Your contribution will be licensed under GPL-3.0-or-later

  • You have the right to submit the code (you wrote it or have permission)

  • You retain copyright to your contribution

  • Your contribution becomes part of the project under the same license

Copyright Assignment

rax25kb does not require copyright assignment. Contributors retain copyright to their contributions.

Third-Party Code

When submitting code from other sources:

  • Ensure the code is GPL-compatible licensed

  • Include original copyright notices

  • Include original license information

  • Document the source in commit messages

See contributing.rst for detailed contribution guidelines.

License Exceptions and Special Cases

Configuration Files

Configuration files (*.cfg) you create for rax25kb are not considered derivative works. You are not required to license them under GPL.

Your configuration files are yours to keep private or share as you choose.

Documentation

Documentation in the docs/ directory is licensed under GPL-3.0-or-later along with the code. You may:

  • Copy and modify documentation

  • Create your own documentation

  • Share documentation under compatible licenses

PCAP Files

PCAP capture files generated by rax25kb are not derivative works of the software. They contain your packet data and are not covered by GPL.

You control the license and distribution of PCAP files you create.

Log Files

Log files generated by rax25kb are not derivative works. They are your data and not covered by GPL.

Trademark and Branding

Name and Logo

“rax25kb” is not a registered trademark. You may:

  • Use the name when referring to the software

  • Use the name in derivative works with clear indication of modifications

  • Create your own branding for substantially modified versions

When distributing modified versions, please:

  • Clearly indicate that it is a modified version

  • Not imply official endorsement

  • Consider using a different name for major forks

Call Sign

The author’s call sign (KE4AHR) is used for identification purposes and is regulated by the FCC (in the United States). It is not covered by GPL.

Warranty Disclaimer

NO WARRANTY

THERE IS NO WARRANTY FOR THE PROGRAM, TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY
APPLICABLE LAW. EXCEPT WHEN OTHERWISE STATED IN WRITING THE COPYRIGHT
HOLDERS AND/OR OTHER PARTIES PROVIDE THE PROGRAM "AS IS" WITHOUT
WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT
LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR
A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE
OF THE PROGRAM IS WITH YOU. SHOULD THE PROGRAM PROVE DEFECTIVE, YOU
ASSUME THE COST OF ALL NECESSARY SERVICING, REPAIR OR CORRECTION.

Limitation of Liability

LIMITED LIABILITY

IN NO EVENT UNLESS REQUIRED BY APPLICABLE LAW OR AGREED TO IN WRITING
WILL ANY COPYRIGHT HOLDER, OR ANY OTHER PARTY WHO MODIFIES AND/OR
CONVEYS THE PROGRAM AS PERMITTED ABOVE, BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR DAMAGES,
INCLUDING ANY GENERAL, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES
ARISING OUT OF THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE PROGRAM (INCLUDING BUT
NOT LIMITED TO LOSS OF DATA OR DATA BEING RENDERED INACCURATE OR LOSSES
SUSTAINED BY YOU OR THIRD PARTIES OR A FAILURE OF THE PROGRAM TO OPERATE
WITH ANY OTHER PROGRAMS), EVEN IF SUCH HOLDER OR OTHER PARTY HAS BEEN
ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

Regulatory Compliance

FCC Compliance (United States)

Amateur radio operators using rax25kb must comply with FCC Part 97 rules, including:

  • Proper station identification

  • Authorized frequency use

  • Power limits

  • Prohibited transmissions

rax25kb is a tool. You are responsible for legal and proper operation.

International Use

Amateur radio regulations vary by country. Users outside the United States must comply with their local regulations.

Export Controls

rax25kb uses no cryptography and has no export restrictions beyond those applicable to standard software.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I use rax25kb commercially?

Yes. GPL allows commercial use. You may charge for services (installation, support, hosting) but not for the software itself, and you must provide source code to recipients.

Do I need to share my configuration files?

No. Configuration files are not derivative works and are not covered by GPL.

Can I link rax25kb with proprietary software?

Generally, no. GPL requires the combined work to be GPL. However:

  • Communication through standard protocols (TCP) is not linking

  • You can use rax25kb as a separate program

  • Consult a lawyer for specific situations

Can I relicense rax25kb?

No, unless you are the copyright holder. GPL requires derivative works to remain GPL. You may only offer “or later” GPL versions.

What if I violate the GPL?

  • Your GPL license terminates automatically

  • Copyright holder may take legal action

  • You can cure violation by coming into compliance

  • Persistent violations may result in permanent termination

Can I use a different license for my fork?

No. Derivative works must be licensed under GPL-3.0-or-later. You may add “or later” but cannot change to a different license.

Getting License Help

Questions About This License

For questions specific to rax25kb licensing:

  • Contact: Kris Kirby, KE4AHR <kris@outel.org>

  • Open an issue: https://github.com/ke4ahr/rax25kb/issues

  • Tag with “license” label

General GPL Questions

For general GPL questions:

  • GNU Website: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.html

  • FSF: licensing@fsf.org

  • Software Freedom Law Center: https://softwarefreedom.org/

Note: The author is not a lawyer. For legal advice, consult an attorney.

License Compliance

How to Comply with GPL

If you distribute rax25kb binaries:

  1. Include complete source code, or

  2. Provide written offer to supply source code, or

  3. Point to where source code is available (for non-commercial distribution)

If you modify and distribute rax25kb:

  1. Clearly mark your modifications

  2. Include your source code

  3. License under GPL-3.0-or-later

  4. Update copyright notices appropriately

  5. Document your changes

Always:

  1. Include a copy of the GPL license

  2. Preserve copyright notices

  3. Include appropriate legal notices

Recommended Distribution

When distributing rax25kb:

rax25kb-2.0.0/
├── rax25kb              # Binary
├── LICENSE              # GPL-3.0 full text
├── README.md            # Project information
├── CHANGELOG.rst        # Version history
├── docs/                # Documentation
└── src/                 # Source code (if distributing source)

Acknowledgments

License Choice

The GPL license was chosen to honor the traditions of free software and amateur radio communities, both of which value:

  • Open sharing of knowledge

  • Community collaboration

  • Technical experimentation

  • Learning and education

Standing on the Shoulders of Giants

rax25kb builds on decades of work by:

  • Amateur radio packet pioneers

  • KISS protocol creators (K3MC, KA9Q)

  • AX.25 specification authors

  • Free software developers

  • The Rust programming language team

Thank you to all who came before.
